definitions.definition: The act of offering (an idea) for consideration .
An idea , plan , or suggestion offered .

subdefinitions.definition: A suggestion of sexual intercourse (made to someone with whom one is not sexually involved ).

definitions.definition: The terms of a transaction offered.
In some states , a proposed statute or constitutional amendment to be voted on by the electorate .

English Wikipedia has an article on: Proposition Wikipedia ( countable , logic ) The content of an assertion that may be taken as being true or false and is considered abstractly without reference to the linguistic sentence that constitutes the assertion; ( Aristotelian logic ) a predicate of a subject that is denied or affirmed and is connected by a copula .
examples: “Wiktionary is a good dictionary” is a proposition .

definitions.definition: An assertion so formulated that it can be considered true or false .
An assertion which is provably true , but not important enough to be called a theorem .
A statement of religious doctrine ; an article of faith ; a creed .
examples: the propositions of Wyclif and Huss

definitions.definition: The part of a poem in which the author states the subject or matter of it.

main_definition: ( uncountable ) The act of offering (an idea) for consideration .
secondary_definitions: ( countable ) An idea , plan , or suggestion offered .
( countable , business settings ) The terms of a transaction offered.
( countable , US , politics ) In some states , a proposed statute or constitutional amendment to be voted on by the electorate .

English Wikipedia has an article on: Proposition Wikipedia ( countable , logic ) The content of an assertion that may be taken as being true or false and is considered abstractly without reference to the linguistic sentence that constitutes the assertion; ( Aristotelian logic ) a predicate of a subject that is denied or affirmed and is connected by a copula .
( countable , mathematics ) An assertion so formulated that it can be considered true or false .
( countable , mathematics ) An assertion which is provably true , but not important enough to be called a theorem .
A statement of religious doctrine ; an article of faith ; a creed .
( poetic ) The part of a poem in which the author states the subject or matter of it.
